Subject: Heritrix URI and queue priority
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=500983475; y=Uv69P8tQeXS5GxuVoyUEKCtB7D2oDsGiFhjFP3Y5fYF-U1PNussuVQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: david_pane1


I have a couple of questions about how Heritrix handles frontier queue 
priority and URI priority.

1) If a frontier queue has a depth of 10,000 and another queue has a 
depth of 1 million, does the queue with a depth of 1 million get 
activated more often than the queue with a depth of 10,000?  In other 
words do queues that are large receive higher priority than small queues?


2) Is there a way to add a URI to the top of an existing queue?  As an 
example:

Given a domain xyz.com which has a queue depth of 400, can I add the uri 
(through the action directory) http://www.xxx.com/bla/index.html so that 
it is crawled before any other URI in that queue?  (providing it hasn't 
already been crawled )

Thanks,

David
